snippet: Chadian soldiers fought their way into Dikwa, which had been in militant hands for months, and the army of Nigeria took Monguno, in the northeastern part of the nation.
abstract: Chad's military takes control of Nigerian town of Dikwa, occupied by Boko Haram militants for five months, in Chad's deepest push into militant territory; analysts say it is too soon to tell if Chad's advances will turn tide against Boko Haram.
lead_paragraph: Chadian soldiers fought their way into Dikwa, which had been in militant hands for months, and the army of Nigeria took Monguno, in the northeastern part of the nation.

headline.main: In Nigeria, Boko Haram Loses Ground to Chadians
headline.print_headline: In Nigeria, Boko Haram Loses Ground to Chadians
